task.title: Cloning a repository
task.shortdesc: Cloning creates a local copy of a remote repository on your local drive.

step.cmd: In the toolbar, click Clone new repository icon.
Enter the URL of the repository that you want to clone.
From the Checkout branch drop-down list, choose the branch to check out.
step.info: Typically, the default branch for a repository is the “master” branch.

step.cmd: Next to the Destination path field, click the Browse File System icon and select an empty folder for the clone.

info.note: If the target destination is not empty, you must create a new empty folder for the cloned repository.

result.p: The clone is now available under the specified destination path. The add-on automatically sets the newly cloned repository as the current working copy.
